result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dwight E Dean

defendant.name: Dean, Dwight E
defendant.address: 3918 East Maple Street, Oak Creek, WI 53154

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dwight E Dean appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Paul A. Ksicinski Mr. appeared by video for Dwight E Dean.  Attorney Karine O'Byrne in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for preliminary hearing. State's witness is present. Defense motion to withdraw as counsel is granted by the court. Defense counsel will notify Public Defender's Office to appoint new counsel for the defendant. Due to Public Defender's Office not able to appoint attorney, Court ordered case adjourned for cause to the trial court for a State V. Lee Hearing. Hearing scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dwight E Dean not in court, in custody.  Attorney Paul A. Ksicinski Mr. appeared by video for Dwight E Dean.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Defense counsel needs more time to meet with his client. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 091058,
Payable Number: 1034494,
Receipt Number: 22RP038496,
Amount: $20.00

Court ordered no contact with S M P AND S E P
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Dwight E Dean appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont appeared by video for Dwight E Dean. Attorney Michael J. Odden appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
